text: William Henry Howell, Ph.D., M.D., LL.D., Sc.D. (February 20, 1860 â€“ February 6, 1945) was an American-born physiologist best known for pioneering the use of heparin as an anticoagulant. He was born in Baltimore, Maryland. Category:1860 births Category:1945 deaths Category:American psychologists Category:Scientists from Baltimore
